table.name: Common Languages
rows: Humans, dwarves, elves, halflings, and other common ancestries

table.name: Monk Unarmed Attacks
intro: Some monk stances allow you to make special unarmed attacks while in those stances. These attacks are summarized here.
footnotes: * {@spell Wild winds stance} is a ki spell, so you can find out more about wind crash on page 402.

table.name: Skills, Key Abilities, and Actions
footnotes: {@sup D} This skill action can be used only during downtime.
{@sup E} This skill action is used during exploration.

{@sup G} This is a general skill action, with a description appearing on pages 234–240 instead of under the entries for the various skills it's used for. Decipher Writing appears on page 234, Earn Income on page 236, Identify Magic and Learn a Spell on page 238, and Subsist on page 240.

table.name: Climb and Swim Distance
intro: This table provides a quick reference for how far you can move with a {@action Climb} or {@action Swim} action.

table.name: General Feats
rows: Gain access to ancestry feats from another ancestry
Become trained in a type of armor
Hold your breath longer and gain benefits against inhaled threats
Become an expert in a saving throw or {@skill Perception}
Die at {@condition dying} 5, rather than dying 4
Regain more HP from rest, recover faster from disease and poisons
Automatically succeed at commanding your mount to move
Ward off a blow with your shield
Increase your maximum HP and reduce the DCs of recovery checks
Become trained in a weapon type
Become more adept at using untrained skills
Search areas in half the time

table.name: Changing Equipment
rows: Draw or put away a worn item, or pick up an item{@sup 1}
Pass an item to or take an item from a willing creature{@sup 2}
Drop an item to the ground
Detach a shield or item strapped to you
Change your grip by removing a hand from an item
Change your grip by adding a hand to an item
Retrieve an item from a backpack{@sup 3}, sack, or similar container
footnotes: {@sup 1} If you retrieve a two-handed item with only one hand, you still need to change your grip before you can wield or use it.
{@sup 2} A creature must have a hand free for someone to pass an item to them, and they might then need to change their grip if they receive an item requiring two hands to wield or use.
{@sup 3} Retrieving an item stowed in your own backpack requires first taking off the backpack with a separate {@action Interact} action.

table.name: Damaging Armor
rows: Metal ({@item breastplate}, {@item chain mail}, {@item chain shirt}, {@item full plate}, {@item half plate}, {@item scale mail}, {@item splint mail})
intro: Your armor's statistics are based on the material it's predominantly made from. It's not likely your armor will take damage, as explained in Item Damage on page 272.

table.name: Shields
footnotes: {@sup 1} Gaining a shield's circumstance bonus to AC requires using the {@action Raise a Shield} action (found on page 472).
{@sup 2} Getting the higher bonus for a tower shield requires using the {@action Take Cover} action (page 471) while the shield is raised.

footnotes: * Statistics for alchemical bombs can be found starting on page 544

table.name: Formulas
footnotes: * Formulas for all 0-level common items from this chapter can be purchased collectively in a {@item basic crafter's book}.

table.name: Spellcasting Services
footnotes: * Plus any cost required to cast the specific spell.

table.name: Cost of Living
footnotes: * You can attempt to Subsist using {@skill Society} or {@skill Survival} (page 240) for free.

table.name: Animals
footnotes: * Might require a deposit equal to the purchase Price.

table.name: Differently Sized Items
footnotes: * An item that would have its Bulk reduced below 1 has light Bulk.

table.name: Alignment Aura
intro: The strength of an alignment aura depends on the level of the creature, item, or spell. The auras of undead, clerics and other divine spellcasters with a patron deity, and creatures from the Outer Sphere are one step stronger than normal (faint instead of none, for example).

table.name: Domains
rows: You can control winds and the weather.
You strive to keep up with and outpace the competition.
You have powers over urban environments and denizens.
You overcome your fear and project pride.
You have divine abilities related to crafting and art.
You operate in the darkness and take away the light.
You have the power to end lives and destroy undead.
You are a conduit for divine devastation.
You have the power to enter and manipulate dreams.
You aid and protect your family and community more effectively.
You see and understand hidden inevitabilities.
You liberate yourself and others from shackles and constraints.
Your healing magic is particularly potent.
You feast mightily and can shake off the effects of overindulging.
You're unnaturally lucky and keep out of harm's way.
You perform the unexpected and inexplicable.
Your physical power is bolstered by divine strength.
You command powers associated with the moon.
You hold power over animals and plants.
You fill minds with horror and dread.
You punish those who displease you with the sharp sting of pain.
You evoke passion, whether as love or lust.
You strive to perfect your mind, body, and spirit.
You protect secrets and keep them hidden.
You harness the power of the sun and other light sources, and punish undead.
You have power over movement and journeys.
You deceive others and cause mischief.
You pierce lies and discover the truth.
You wield power to rule and enslave others.
Your magic carries close ties to the undead.
You control water and bodies of water.
You hold power over wealth, trade, and treasure.
Your inner fire increases your combat prowess.

table.name: Creature XP and Role
rows: Any standard creature or low-threat boss

table.name: DCs by Level
footnotes: * If a spell is uncommon or rare, its difficulty should be adjusted accordingly.

table.name: Party Treasure by Level
footnotes: * Many 1st-level permanent items should be items from Chapter 6 instead of magic items.

table.name: Temperature Effects
footnotes: * Adjust temperatures down by 15 in areas of high humidity.

Glass block, glass table, heavy vase
Chest, simple door, table, tree trunk
Anvil, iron or steel armor, stove

table.name: Fundamental Runes
rows: Increase item bonus to AC and determine maximum number of property runes
Grant an item bonus to attack rolls and determine maximum number of property runes

table.name: Armor Upgrade Prices
rows: 900 gp to etch +2 armor potency (11th level)
3,100 gp to etch greater resilient (14th level)
19,500 gp to etch +3 armor potency (18th level)
46,000 gp to etch major resilient (20th level)

table.name: Weapon Upgrade Price
